tweets.text: Had a walk around @Broughton_Hall this weekend fantastic environmental leadership on show, spectacular landscape scale Natural Flood Management and reforestation to aid carbon capture! Plus just a lovely place to walk around @LeedsFAS @YorkshireiCASP @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/s810ouveII

urls.title: Jeremy Vine describes Walleys Quarry as 'worst smell in Britain' on BBC Radio 2
urls.description: The popular radio presenter explained to listeners how there had been 5,000 complaints about the quarry in the last month - with 2,000 last weekend

tweets.text:
‚ÄúWorst smell in Britain‚Äù-respect @theJeremyVine for coming & smelling the landfill himself & openly stating how bad it is. @DefraGovUK we are not making this up-the @EnvAgency are failing us,pls step in&stop this environmental terrorism #stopthestink 

https://t.co/gjTm3xtfMT

So my #tuesdayvibe is yet again waking up after been poisoned in the night by landfill gas headache sore throat dry itchy eyes @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @PHE_uk this has to end would you live like this? #StopTheStink #CapItOff #AirPollution https://t.co/XYKP4YpoVI

Vegetation clearance starts from tomorrow. A very short visit this am incl: nest building Whitethroat, territorial Cetti's/Reed Warbler & Reed Bunting. Video shows how farcical this is! Still time to see sense @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder  PLEASE RETWEET https://t.co/Tve0B6o4va

Following a massive increase in the theft of catalytic converters across the country. 
The Environment Agency teamed up with @BTP and other partners nationally and recovered over a thousand stolen catalytic converters and more than 50 people were arrested
https://t.co/WA12K6y7YB https://t.co/9dHTQphMPY

tweets.text:
We hope you had a great bank holiday! 

It‚Äôs been a dry month & we‚Äôre asking everyone of our customers to be mindful of non-essential water use in the weeks ahead & join us in becoming a #WaterSavingHero. 

Head to https://t.co/Gfj2uYa8og to get your free water saving devices! https://t.co/LD3LBQUeAE

@copelandbc @MikeStarkie @unitedutilities @CumbriaHighways @HighwaysNWEST @EnvAgency @CumbriaCC Reported severe flooding & damage to property on many occasions. Requested contact but getting no response. Help desperately needed. How would you feel if this was your property? https://t.co/SqVZgMFspD

Notification from @thameswater  yesterday evening of another sewage discharge into the  @RiverChess. Number  83 for the year 2021. So 83/122 days as a percentage is 68%. Wonder if we will be getting that knocked off our bills?

We're encouraging everyone to make every drop count this summer with our #WatersWorthSaving campaign.

Why not make a start this #BankHoliday!

Find out more: https://t.co/i2NRiZpvDe

@Waterwise @EnvAgency @Ofwat @CCWvoice 

#BankHolidayMonday

@HarrietRycroft @WiseBirding @BirdygirlDevon @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder Unfortunately, HS2 have warned me in no uncertain terms, to stay away from the site & from approaching the ecologists. Think I was asking too many difficult questions of them. They sadly, seem to be a law unto themselves.

Walking along the River Hiz there seems to be a hotspot of rubbish. It seems to be emanating from the scrap metal site NMR. Surely part of their license renewal can be that they are made to clean up after themselves?? #Hitchin #LegalisedFlyTipping @EnvAgency @NorthHertsDC https://t.co/gIKN59AKdH

@SarahofScrubs @WiseBirding @BirdygirlDevon @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder Who are these ‚Äúecologists‚Äù ? I‚Äôd be interested to know what their qualifications are and who is their employer...

Removing this kind of habitat during bird nesting season is appalling practice, and trying to placate us all with the ruse that ecologists will wade through thick brambles to find and protect active nests is insulting. They won‚Äôt. @kiergroup @EnvAgency https://t.co/ekGmPRyEmW
